gnat.client.ner
Class AbstractToSpecies

java.lang.Object
  gnat.client.ner.AbstractToSpecies
Deprecated. 

@Deprecated
public class AbstractToSpecies
extends java.lang.Object

Deprecated: this should be replaced with another species-service running on a dedicated machine.

Queries AliBaba for species mentioned in a text or abstract for a given PubMed ID. Returns a set of NCBI Taxonomy IDs.

A tagger with a lexicon derived from NCBI Taxonomy (ca. 200,000 entries) handles the initial recognition species' names in the given text. Additionally, searches for cell lines mentioned in the text and resolves them to the species they originate from. For instance, a mention of "HeLa cells" get mapped to the species 9606, human, "COS-7 cells" originate from 10090, mouse.

The default workflow should look like this:

  • Get a text annotated for species using AskAliBaba;
  • annotatedTextToMap -- extract the set of species as a map to evidence strings;
  • removeSpeciesWithAmbiguousNames -- remove species for which only ambiguous names were used from that map;
  • get the keySet from the remaining map
  • getIndirectReferences -- add all indirect references (cell lines etc.)
  • normalizeSpecies -- remove, if wanted, general mentions such as kingdoms, families, etc. ("mammalian", "viruses")

URL to AskAliBaba:
http://alibaba.informatik.hu-berlin.de/servlet/AskAliBaba

Author:
Joerg Hakenberg

normalizeTaxonIDs

public java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer> normalizeTaxonIDs(java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer> ids)
Deprecated. 
Removes tax IDs from a set, for which no genes exists: kingdoms, families, etc. Replaces too general species with more specific ones, for instance, murinae with M.mus. Calls normalizeTaxonID for each ID.

Parameters:
species -
Returns:

normalizeTaxonID(int)

normalizeTaxonID

public int[] normalizeTaxonID(int tax)
Deprecated. 
Checks a taxon ID and returns more specific/more general IDs for certain cases. Returns an array of IDs that should replace the initial taxon ID. If the array is empty, the annotation should be removed.
Examples:
  • murinae, murine, and mice => M. musculus
  • rat and rats => R. norvegicus
  • viruses > too general, delete
  • rodents => abiguous, add M. mus and R. norv
  • Drosophila => D. mel
TODO: place mappings mammals => human here, depending on user's needs

Parameters:
tax -
Returns:

removeSpeciesWithAmbiguousNames

private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String>> removeSpeciesWithAmbiguousNames(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String>> species)
Deprecated. 
Remove some spurious mentions of species --- mostly false positives from the initial annotator. For example, remove the species "cancers" (6754) if it was not mentioned with any other name (Crustacea, crab) in the same text. Assumption in this case: it is highly likely a reference to neoplasms.

Parameters:
species -
Returns:

getIndirectReferencesAndNames

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String>> getIndirectReferencesAndNames(java.lang.String text)
Deprecated. 
Looks for indirect mentions of species in a text, for instance by means of cell lines and related terms. Returns a mapping from NCBI Taxon IDs to recognized terms.
For instance, a mention of Jurkat cells clearly indicates that the species is human, Tax ID 9606.

Parameters:
text -
Returns:

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Deprecated. 
For testing purposes. Submits a query for a text and then another one for a PubMed ID. Should result in this output:

[8355, 9606] --- query for a text that mentions two species directly
[9534, 9606] --- query for a PubMed ID, one direct mention, one of cells
[4932] --- query for a PubMed ID, no species mentioned in abstract/title, thus analyze MeSH terms

Parameters:
args -
